Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: First looking at the event log there are three cases Lets list out the sequences for each case Case 1 RA VF AE RMI VF AD SC AC Case 2 RA VF AE AD SC AC Case 3 RA VF AE RMI RMI VF AD SC AC

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: So the main sequence seems to be RA then VF then AE then possibly some RMI and VF steps then AD SC and finally AC

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: All cases start with RA Then VF Then AE Then in some cases theres one or more RMI followed by VF In case 1 RMI then VF in case 3 RMI RMI then VF Case 2 has no RMI

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: in case 1 after AE its RMI then VF in case 3 after AE its RMI RMI then VF So its like after AE you can have a sequence of RMI followed by VF but the RMI can happen multiple times before the VF

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: So its not RMI VF pairs but multiple RMIs followed by a single VF So the pattern is after AE you can have zero or more RMIs then a VF then proceed to AD But in case 2 after AE its AD

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: the structure after AE is optionally one or more RMIs followed by VF

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: The loop operator A is executed then either exit the loop or you execute B and then A again

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: model the RMI part as a loop where A is RMI and B is tau if we have RMI tau that would mean execute RMI then either exit or execute tau and then RMI again Since tau is silent its like executing RMI multiple times

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: After AE we have a choice between doing the RMI VF sequence or not So the structure is AE X seq loop RMIs VF tau AD Because the exclusive choice is between doing the RMI VF sequence or doing nothing tau and then we proceed to AD

Name: Validation - PE
Text: confirm with the cases Case 1 AE RMI VF AD This would be the first branch of X loop RMIs tau which does RMI once then VF then AD Case 2 AE AD This would be the second branch of X tau then AD Case 3 AE RMI RMI VF AD loop does RMI twice then VF then AD Yes that matches all cases

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: The full structure is RA VF AE X seq LOOP RMI tau VF tau AD SC AC

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Now lets verify with the logs Case 1 trace matches Case 2 trace matches Case 3 trace matches This seems to fit Also the model doesnt allow VF after AE without RMIs which matches the logs
